uni.hamburg.yamms.solver
Class State

java.lang.Object
  uni.hamburg.yamms.solver.State

public class State
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a simulation state consisting of:

  • the magnetization
  • the derivative of the magnetization
  • the simulation time
  • the simulation step
  • a hash map of additional parameters that can be set and altered by event handlers and read by field terms.

Author:
Claas Abert

getStub

public static State getStub(RealVectorField m)

Parameters:

Returns:
return state stub

derive

public State derive(double[] m,
                    double[] mDot,
                    double t)
Derives a state from the current state. (All attributes stay the same except the magnetization the derivative and the simulation time)

Parameters:
m - the new magnetization values
mDot - the new derivative values
t - the new simulation time
Returns:
the derived state

step

public void step(double[] m,
                 double[] mDot,
                 double t)
Submits a step (the combination of magnetization, derivative and simulation time). The number of steps if increased.

Parameters:
m - the magnetization values
mDot - the derivative of the magnetization values
t - the simulation time

step

                 RealVectorField mDot,
                 double t)

Parameters:

mDot - the derivative of the magnetization
t - the simulation time

init

public void init(Model model,
                 RealVectorField m0)
Init method for dormand prince intergrator. the derivative for t=0 is calculated for the first call of handlers

Parameters:
model - the model
m0 - the initial magnetization
